page.title: 07Farming Around Appleby
page.content: Farming is the biggest industry in and around Appleby.Most of the land is used for growing grass for silage and hay.I live on a farm called Low Barn its two miles out of Appleby.About half of the four hundred and fifteen acres we own is used to grow grass for silage and hay. We own about four hundred sheep and two hundred cows.Our cows are freisians we use most of them to milk and sell the milk to the Express Dairy at Appleby.The other cows are fattened up to sell for beef.We keep the ewe sheep for lambs and sell the hogs.When the ewes get old we keep all the hogs and sell the old ewes. The busiest time of the year is in the summer when we cut the grass for silage and hay. Ian Atkinson
